item.title: GEE Python API and CHIRPS: Analyzing precipitation in Buenos Aires - Part 1
item.description: Project Overview Welcome back! In this post, we’ll delve into the severe drought that affected Buenos Aires Province in Argentina, in 2023, using the CHIRPS dataset and the Google Earth Engine (GEE) Python API. As detailed in the GEE catalog, CHIRPS—short for Climate Hazards Group InfraRed Precipitation with Station data—is a 30+ year quasi-global rainfall dataset. This dataset integrates satellite imagery with in-situ station data at a 0.05° resolution to generate gridded rainfall at daily temporal resolution.
